text.__SUMMARY__:
Salvia leucocephala is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae that is native to Ecuador.
Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical dry shrubland.
text.Sources: Montúfar, R. & Pitman, N. (2004). "Salvia leucocephala". The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. IUCN. 2004: e.T45573A11005299. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T45573A11005299.en. Retrieved 18 December 2017.
